modulesStudied.name: Global Engineering Challenge Week
modulesStudied.description: Worked with students from other engineering disciplines, to tackle a real-world problem in an underdeveloped region. The proposal heavily involves the local community in gathering the plastic, which is then fed through a plastic extruder. The recycled plastic can then be used for 3D printing various things, to give back to the locals.

modulesStudied.name: Introduction to Software Engineering
modulesStudied.description: Involved a group project emulating an agile development process. Developed a student-mentor matching website with Ruby as the backend, using the Sinatra gem. The application is intended for students to learn about the industry they are interested in, which the mentor is a part of. My responsibilities included designing and implementing the backend/database, as well as most of the major functionalities in the system.

modulesStudied.name: Machines and Intelligence
modulesStudied.description: Went on a deep dive into the history and philosophies of robotics. Then went on to learn various search algorithms like breadth/depth-first search, and the A* Algorithm. Involved in a project implementing the depth and A* algorithms for pathfinding with an abstract overview of a map.

modulesStudied.name: Java Programming
modulesStudied.description: Built a good understanding of the Object-Oriented Programming paradigm and the Java language.

modulesStudied.name: Foundations of Computer Science
modulesStudied.description: A discrete maths course on logic and linear algebra.

modulesStudied.name: Devices and Networks
modulesStudied.description: Involved learning digital logic, computer arithmetic, internet protocols, and data transmission over the internet.

modulesStudied.name: Web and Internet Technology
modulesStudied.description: (Re)Learned the fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and built a personal-portfolio website (not this one) as an assignment.

modulesStudied.name: Introduction to Algorithms and Data Structures
modulesStudied.description: Learned fundamental data structures in Computer Science, as well as algorithm design and complexity analysis.

modulesStudied.name: Engineering - You're Hired
modulesStudied.description: Involved in a cross-disciplinary group project to address a real-world problem, with the theme of IoT. Came up with a proposal plan for developing a physical network of sensors for detecting floods. Also involves developing an application to warn and redirect drivers.

modulesStudied.name: Data Driven Computing
modulesStudied.description: A machine learning course which involved learning various classification techniques, including both supervised (Naive Bayes, k-nearest neighbor, deep learning) and unsupervised (clustering). Developed a chess piece image classification system implementing both the Naive Bayes and k-nearest neighbour algorithms.

modulesStudied.name: Systems Design and Security
modulesStudied.description: Involved a group project emulating a real-world agile software development process, with formal requirements analysis and system design process, utilizing UML diagrams. Developed a property booking desktop app following the MVC architecture, with Java as frontend and backend, linking to MySQL database. My responsibilities included all of the above-mentioned things and implementation of the entire system.

modulesStudied.name: Robotics
modulesStudied.description: Involved a group project programming a small robot dog with Python ROS, in both a simulation and the actual hardware, to complete various tasks such as maze completion, obstacle avoidance, and beaconing (finding and moving towards a target). Ended up completing the entire project by myself, but enjoyed the work involved and took the opportunity to learn a lot.

modulesStudied.name: Software Hut
modulesStudied.description: Involved in a group project following an agile development process. Developed an extenuating circumstances system for university staff members, with the Ruby on Rails framework. The system lets students make appeals regarding deadline extensions or poor performances on tests, for example. My responsibilities included designing the entire system with UML diagrams, designing and implementing the database, and implementing most of the major functionalities.

modulesStudied.name: Logic in Computer Science
modulesStudied.description: Prove it.

modulesStudied.name: Functional Programming
modulesStudied.description: Learned the fundamentals of Haskell. Involved an assignment to program and solve a solitaire game with the language.

modulesStudied.name: Automata, Computation and Complexity
modulesStudied.description: Algorithms on steroids.

modulesStudied.name: Dissertation Project
modulesStudied.description: The title of the dissertation is Exploring Deep Learning for Named Entity Recognition (NER). Developed an NER system from scratch implementing the Multinomial Logistic Regression (MLR) algorithm. Also attempted at developing a Transformer neural network with TensorFlow/Keras (forward inference only).

modulesStudied.name: The Intelligent Web
modulesStudied.description: Involved in a group project to develop a bird sighting web application. Made use of the following technologies: Socket.io for real-time client interactions (used to implement a chat functionality), Node.js for the backend, and MongoDB for data storage. Also made use of browser storage and caching technologies to ensure the website also functions offline locally. My responsibilities included the implementation of most of the major functionalities. (Short demo in GitHub repository)

modulesStudied.name: The Internet of Things
modulesStudied.description: An adult LEGO course. Assembled and developed a remote-controlled robot car (via a WAP and served page) using C/C++, on an ESP32 development board (similar to an Arduino). Also installed an ultrasonic sensor for object detection and avoidance whilst the robot is exploring its environment. (Short demo in GitHub repository)

modulesStudied.name: Text Processing
modulesStudied.description: Learned various text processing techniques. Completed two individual assignments: developed a document retrieval system, and a sentiment analysis system using a classifier implementing the Naive Bayes algorithm.

modulesStudied.name: Bioinspired Computing
modulesStudied.description: Learned various modern artificial intelligence techniques and their inspiration from biological systems. Examples include evolution, multicellular tissues, neural systems, the immune system and swarms, inspiring abstractions such as evolutionary or swarm-based optimization algorithms.

modulesStudied.name: Modelling and Simulation of Natural Systems
modulesStudied.description: Learning about differential equations with application to the Lotka-Volterra (aka. prey-predator) model. Involved in a group assignment, researching the Lorenz System and simulating it.

modulesStudied.name: Adaptive Intelligence
modulesStudied.description: Coded a deep neural network from scratch and modified it for reinforcement learning on a simplified chess game.

modulesStudied.name: Speech Processing
modulesStudied.description: Touched upon the basics of linguistics, and the biology of human speech and hearing. Also gained some speech processing experience using filters.
